availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Thruston Churchill (Jefferson, Hardin, Logan co farmer, maybe member of firm of Thomas & Churchill with Samuel B. Thomas)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Armistead Churchill and Married to Susan Churchill Payne Churchill in Hardin County on March 21, 1850. Father of Henry Churchill, Hampden L. Churchill, Samuel T. Churchill, and Charles T. Churchill. Farmer in Jefferson County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1850. Farmer in Logan County in 1860. Employed H. N. McKinney, George Legrand, John Legrand, and Washington Legrand as farm labor in Logan County in 1860. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Logan County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 954 (p. 3 of microfilm).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 2, p. 541.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 2, 391B (p. 8 of microfilm).
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Elizabethtown, p. 325A.
Find A Grave, "Charles Worden Thruston Churchill (1826-1865)," Memorial 74609374, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/74609374 (accessed January 2, 2020).
Find A Grave, "Susan Churchill Payne Churchill (1829-1875)," Memorial 74609410, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/74609410 (accessed January 2, 2020).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hardin County Marriages, Film #000390788, p. 291 of microfilm.
